text: What is the best way to run a test suite involving downloading a dataset? I want to check if the dataset is downloaded properly and that scripts were executed on it. Any suggestions for this?

elements.text: What is the best way to run a test suite involving downloading a dataset? I want to check if the dataset is downloaded properly and that scripts were executed on it. Any suggestions for this?

text: store hashes of the dataset or the cleaned data, and check that they match?

elements.text: store hashes of the dataset or the cleaned data, and check that they match?

text: That's a great thought <@U011V2YN59N>! Does Julia offer something like an md5sum command or should I generate the hash outside of Julia you think?

elements.text: ! Does Julia offer something like an md5sum command or should I generate the hash outside of Julia you think?

text: julia has the SHA family of hashing algorithms in the SHA stdlib

elements.text: julia has the SHA family of hashing algorithms in the SHA stdlib

text: it's only useful for checking if there were any errors during transmission though, hashing downloaded data does nothing for security

elements.text: it's only useful for checking if there were any errors during transmission though, hashing downloaded data does nothing for security

text: Exactly <@UH24GRBLL> - didn't know Julia had this. Good to know! Thank you! I can add it as a hook for my repo to generate hashes of each dataset before commit and prior to testing.

elements.text: - didn't know Julia had this. Good to know! Thank you! I can add it as a hook for my repo to generate hashes of each dataset before commit and prior to testing.
